item.title: Curvature of Curves
item.description: Consider a circle \(C_r\) of radius \(r\) , say \(x^2 + y^2 = r^2\) . Then we shift \(C_r\) up so that \((0,0)\) is now on the circle and the equation becomes \(x^2 + (y - r)^2 = r^2\) . Around the point \((0,0)\) , \(C\) can be described as the graph of $$y = r - \sqrt{r^2 - x^2}$$ Expanding this out using the Taylor series we get
